title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations for child care assistance for military dependents under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2004 to 2008 for this purpose. The Secretary will provide grants to eligible persons to help pay for child care services for dependents by eligible child care providers. Eligible persons are parents of dependents who are members of a reserve component. Members of the Armed Forces on active duty for military operations, responsible for caring for dependents residing at least 50 miles away. Members of the Armed Forces on active duty for military operations must be responsible for dependents living at least 50 miles away from the nearest military installation with child care facilities funded by the Department of Defense. The term 'military operation' includes Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle, or any successor operation. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary with required information, including details of the child care provider. The provisions of this subchapter, excluding certain sections, do not apply to assistance provided under this section. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 regarding appropriations under different sections.
